IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO POSITIVELY IMPACT PEOPLE'S LIVES BY CELEBRATING COLLEGE ATHLETICS THROUGH BEST-IN-CLASS EVENTS THAT CREATE CHARITABLE DONATIONS, SCHOLARSHIPS, AND ECONOMIC IMPACT.
IRS990.MissionDesc: PEACH BOWL INC.'S MISSION IS TO POSITIVELY IMPACT PEOPLE'S LIVES BY CELEBRATING COLLEGE ATHLETICS THROUGH BEST-IN-CLASS EVENTS THAT CREATE CHARITABLE DONATIONS, SCHOLARSHIPS, ECONOMIC IMPACT, AND MEMORABLE EXPERIENCES. PEACH BOWL INC. IS PROUD TO BE THE MOST CHARITABLE COLLEGE FOOTBALL BOWL ORGANIZATION IN THE COUNTRY.
IRS990.Desc: THE CHICK-FIL-A KICKOFF GAME AND ITS CHARITABLE GIVING PLATFORM WERE CREATED TO FOSTER & PROMOTE NCAA FOOTBALL COMPETITION AND TO SUPPORT COLLEGE EDUCATION THROUGH SCHOLARSHIP DONATIONS. THE KICKOFF GAME IS A NEUTRAL SITE COLLEGE FOOTBALL GAME WHICH IS PLAYED AT THE BEGINNING OF EVERY SEASON. IN THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING MAY 31, 2023, PEACH BOWL, INC HOSTED TWO CHICK-FIL-A KICKOFF GAMES AND CONTRIBUTED A TOTAL OF $13,000,000 VIA GAME PARTICIPATION PAYOUTS TO THE UNIVERSITY OF GEORGIA, THE UNIVERSITY OF OREGON, AND THE GEORGIA INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE CHICK-FIL-A PEACH BOWL AND ITS CHARITABLE GIVING PLATFORM WERE CREATED TO FOSTER & PROMOTE NCAA FOOTBALL COMPETITION AND TO SUPPORT COLLEGE EDUCATION THROUGH SCHOLARSHIP DONATIONS, AND TO SUPPORT CHILDREN'S HEALTH INITIATIVES, DISASTER RELIEF, AND OTHER DESERVING CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS IN OUR COMMUNITY AND IN THE COMMUNITIES OF OUR PARTICIPATING UNIVERSITIES. IN THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING MAY 31, 2023, PEACH BOWL INC DONATED $310,847 TO CHILDRENS HEALTHCARE OF ATLANTA, $250,000 TO THE YMCA OF ATLANTA, $250,000 TO THE WESTSIDE FUTURE FUND, $200,000 TO THE AMERICAN RED CROSS OF GA, $250,000 TO THE ATLANTA PUBLIC SCHOOLS, $100,000 TO GEORGIA LIONS LIGHTHOUSE FOUNDATION, $100,000 TO LIONS CLUB INTERNATIONAL, $50,000 EACH TO THE SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS AT THE UNIVERSITY OF GEORGIA AND THE OHIO STATE UNIVERSITY, AND $187,300 TO VARIOUS OTHER CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: THE SOUTHERN COMPANY PEACH BOWL CHALLENGE GOLF TOURNAMENT AND ITS CHARITABLE GIVING PLATFORM WERE CREATED TO FOSTER & PROMOTE NCAA COMPETITION AND TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS IN OUR COMMUNITY, AND IN THE COMMUNITIES OF THE PARTICIPATING UNIVERSITIES. IN THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING MAY 31, 2023, THE SOUTHERN COMPANY PEACH BOWL CHALLENGE EVENT DONATED A TOTAL OF $302,500 TO VARIOUS CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS AS SELECTED BY THE FOOTBALL COACHES PARTICIPATING IN THE EVENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PBI IS RECOGNIZED AS AN ORGANIZATION EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAX UNDER SECTION 501(A) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE (THE CODE) AS AN ORGANIZATION DESCRIBED IN SECTION 501(C)(3), WHEREBY ONLY UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME, AS DEFINED BY SECTION 512(A)(1) OF THE CODE, IS SUBJECT TO FEDERAL INCOME TAX. PBI IS EXEMPT FROM STATE INCOME TAX UNDER SIMILAR PROVISIONS OF THE GEORGIA STATUTES. PBI DID NOT HAVE INCOME UNRELATED TO ITS EXEMPT PURPOSES DURING THE YEARS ENDED MAY 31, 2023 AND 2022. PBI RECOGNIZES THE EFFECT OF INCOME TAX POSITIONS ONLY IF THOSE POSITIONS ARE MORE LIKELY THAN NOT OF BEING SUSTAINED. RECOGNIZED INCOME TAX POSITIONS ARE MEASURED AT THE LARGEST AMOUNT THAT IS GREATER THAN 50% LIKELY OF BEING REALIZED. CHANGES IN RECOGNITION OR MEASUREMENT ARE REFLECTED IN THE PERIOD IN WHICH THE CHANGE IN JUDGMENT OCCURS. PBI DOES NOT HAVE UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT REQUIRE ADJUSTMENT. IN THE NORMAL COURSE OF BUSINESS, PBI IS SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY THE FEDERAL AND STATE TAXING AUTHORITIES. IN GENERAL, PBI IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO TAX EXAMINATIONS FOR THE TAX YEARS ENDED BEFORE MAY 31, 2020.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AMOUNTS PAID TO TEAMS PARTICIPATING IN THE CHICK-FIL-A KICKOFF GAMES ARE AGREED UPON CONTRACTUALLY BY THE SCHOOL'S ATHLETIC DEPARTMENT ADMINISTRATION AND PEACH BOWL, INC. REMAINING GRANTS ARE APPROVED BY THE PEACH BOWL, INC. EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE.

GARY STOKAN, PRESIDENT AND CEO RECEIVED FIRST CLASS TRAVEL AND TRAVEL FOR HIS SPOUSE. HE IS PERMITTED TO FLY FIRST CLASS ONLY WHEN THE LENGTH OF THE FLIGHT EXCEEDS 3 HOURS. THE SPOUSE OF THE CEO IS PERMITTED TO TRAVEL WITH THE CEO WHEN IT IS IN THE BEST INTEREST OF THE COMPANY FOR HER TO ATTEND AN EVENT WITH HIM.

PEACH BOWL INC. HAS A COMPENSATION COMMITTEE THAT REVIEWS AND APPROVES EMPLOYEE COMPENSATION. THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE USES COMPENSATION SURVEYS AND OTHER INDEPENDENT DATA TO SET COMPETITIVE COMPENSATION LEVELS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, QUESTION 8
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PEACH BOWL, INC. MAINTAINS MINUTES FOR ALL MEETINGS HELD BY THE GOVERNING BODY AND COMMITTEES ACTING ON BEHALF OF THE GOVERNING BODY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, QUESTION 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 WAS PREPARED BY A PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM WITH INPUT FROM THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER OF PEACH BOWL, INC. A DRAFT COPY WAS THEN REVIEWED BY THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER AND THE PRESIDENT AND CEO. CHANGES WERE SUBMITTED TO THE TAX PREPARER AND THE FINAL RETURN WAS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE CFO AND THE PRESIDENT AND CEO. THE FORM 990 WAS THEN SUBMITTED TO THE AUDIT COMMITTEE FOR FINAL REVIEW AND APPROVAL. ALL COMMENTS AND SUGGESTED CHANGES WERE INCORPORATED INTO THE FINAL RETURN. THE FINAL FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE COMPLETE BOARD PRIOR TO FILING AND IS MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC ON THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, QUESTION 12
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANNUALLY, EACH EMPLOYEE AND BOARD MEMBER IS REQUIRED TO REVIEW THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. THIS IS DOCUMENTED BY A SIGNED CONFIRMATION STATEMENT FROM EACH PERSON. IF THE EMPLOYEE OR BOARD MEMBER HAS A POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST WITH A PERSON, FIRM OR ENTITY WHICH DOES BUSINESS WITH, OR PROPOSES TO DO BUSINESS WITH THE BOWL, THEY MUST DISCLOSE THIS IN WRITING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, QUESTION 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PEACH BOWL INC. HAS A COMPENSATION COMMITTEE THAT REVIEWS AND APPROVES EMPLOYEE COMPENSATION. THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE USES COMPENSATION SURVEYS AND OTHER INDEPENDENT DATA TO SET COMPETITIVE COMPENSATION LEVELS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PEACH BOWL, INC. MAKES ITS FORM 990 AVAILABLE FOR INSPECTION ON ITS ORGANIZATION WEBSITE AND UPON REQUEST. PEACH BOWL, INC. DOES NOT MAKE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, OR FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC.
